info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 12:52PM EDT until July 13 at 2:33AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. Farmington River At Unionville affecting Hartford County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Deerfield River...including Charlemont, West Deerfield... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Montague. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Flooding will expand into portions of Montague and Greenfield downstream through Sunderland and Whately. Some residential areas may become inundated and localized road closures may be needed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 21.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 35.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.4 feet on 03/28/1953. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EDT.
